My daughter and I spent one night at Casini's Corner, and I am sad we were not able to stay longer. Since the area had just experienced snow and ice, Louanne and Tony had to have spent countless hours cleaning and treating surfaces so that we had a clear place to park and a pathway to the entrance. There are so many thoughtful touches such as this that we noticed immediately upon arrival. Louanne and Tony were there to greet us and to make sure we could get in, which was lovely since we arrived after the sun went down and it was dark. Stepping inside, we immediately noticed that the area was tastefully decorated, warm and inviting. There was soft lighting throughout, the TV was showing a beautiful winter scene and there were two hot chocolate bombs and farm fresh milk in the mini fridge. The hosts have a gift for decorating and making guests feel warm and welcome. We noticed an abundance of fluffy pillows and blankets, two electric fireplaces for ambiance and added warmth, an enormous bathroom with plenty of fluffy towels, extra sheets and pillows, and winter country decor adorning may surfaces. We both spent time relaxing and finishing up some reading before turning in for the night. We had to get up for an early start the next day, so the selection of coffee and tea to start the day off right was perfect.
It is worth mentioning that we felt very safe, which is important to note since we were two females traveling alone. I would not hesitate to recommend this to anyone, even single travelers.
Louanne offered to share their dinner with us; they had made pizza and had extra. A very sweet offer, but we had just eaten before leaving home and I knew we both had reading we had to finish. I do believe the hosts would be open to connecting with guests, if you are interested and able, but also will leave you to be if you have a full schedule or perhaps just prefer to not socialize.
I hope to be back someday with my husband. I would love to spend some time there in the warmer months when we can enjoy the beautiful back yard, patio and pond. And perhaps we can get to know the hosts a bit :)
